title: Nikola Vucevic, Celtics roll into All-Star break with blowout win over Bulls: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Nikola Vucevic scored 19 points off the bench in Boston Celtics' 124-105 win over the Chicago Bulls.
Payton Pritchard contributed 26 points on 11-for-18 shooting, maintaining a low turnover rate in the Celtics' win.
Anfernee Simons expressed openness to returning to Boston, praising his time and relationships built with the team.

title: ‘Modern day concentration camp’: Irish man living in Boston area has been in ICE detention for 5 months
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Seamus Culleton, an Irish man in Boston, has been held in ICE detention for five months after overstaying his visa.
Culleton, detained in Texas, reports poor detention conditions and missed his green card interview due to custody.
Despite bail being initially granted, the government rescinded it, and Culleton denied signing alleged removal documents.

title: Will Patriots move on from Stefon Diggs? Maye says WR has a lot ‘left in the tank’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots may cut Stefon Diggs to save up to $20.8 million in cap space given his $20.6 million base salary.
Diggs, facing legal challenges, nonetheless recorded over 1,000 receiving yards in the 2025 season for New England.
Quarterback Drake Maye supports Diggs, who is focused on offseason recovery after a past ACL injury.

title: Watch: Maynard police, fire crews save dog from ‘pet owner’s worst nightmare’
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Maynard police and fire departments rescued a dog from Mill Pond after it fell through the ice Tuesday night.
A drone was used to guide firefighters in quickly rescuing the dog, Rufus, from the frigid waters.
Rufus returned home with no serious injuries, and the Fire Department shared a rescue video online.

title: Signal issues cause multiple delays and cancellations on at least 6 commuter rail lines
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Signal issues caused delays on all 12 MBTA commuter rail lines, with trains delayed up to 50 minutes.
More than 25 MBTA commuter rail trains were canceled Wednesday due to signal problems.
A power issue shut down the Blue Line from Orient Heights to Wonderland; service resumed after using shuttles.

title: Former Worcester councilor found guilty of assault on police officer related to ICE arrest
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Etel Haxhiaj found guilty of assaulting a police officer but acquitted of interfering with an officer.
Haxhiaj sentenced to six months probation and 40 hours of community service for assault charge.
Incident occurred during ICE arrest in Worcester; sparked protests and criticism from city council.

title: JetBlue lounge at Logan Airport will make its debut this summer
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: JetBlue's BlueHouse BOS lounge opens this summer in Terminal C at Logan International Airport near gate C23.
The 11,000 sq. ft. Boston lounge will be nearly 40% larger than the 8,000 sq. ft. JFK lounge.
BlueHouse BOS offers complimentary food, a full-service bar, and private workspaces with free WiFi for passengers.

title: ESPN predicts Patriots will target offensive lineman with 1st-round pick in 2026 NFL Draft
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: ESPN's Field Yates predicts Patriots will select Utah's Caleb Lomu as a 2026 first-round draft pick.
The Patriots' offensive line struggles in Super Bowl LX highlight the need for line reinforcements.
Coach Mike Vrabel affirms that Will Campbell will remain New England's left tackle despite postseason criticism.

title: New Red Sox Caleb Durbin models his game after former Boston MVP
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Caleb Durbin, new Red Sox infielder, admires Dustin Pedroia and models his game after the former MVP.
Durbin was acquired in a six-player trade with the Brewers and finished third in 2025 NL Rookie of the Year voting.
Durbin projects as a strong defender and hopes to improve his power at Fenway Park in his second MLB season.

title: Jaylen Brown offers Drake Maye advice on how to ‘level up’ after  championship heartbreak
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jaylen Brown advised Patriots quarterback Drake Maye to use the Super Bowl loss as motivation for improvement.
Brown shared personal experiences of championship losses and emphasized the importance of not letting defeat break one's spirit.
Brown encouraged Maye to 'level up,' suggesting finding personal peace, like investing in a harp, to help cope with pressure.
